context: Various <b5_0>auto racing organizations<b5_0/> hold exhibition events; these events usually award no championship points to participants, but they do offer prize money to participants. The NASCAR Sprint Cup Series holds <a0_0>two<a0_0/> exhibition events annually - <b6_0>the Sprint Unlimited, held at <a1_0><b8_0>Daytona International Speedway<b8_0/><a1_0/> at the start of the season, and the <b7_0>NASCAR Sprint All-Star Race<b7_0/>,<b6_0/> held at <a2_0>Charlotte Motor Speedway<a2_0/> midway through the season. Both events carry a hefty purse of <a3_0>over USD $1,000,000<a3_0/>. NASCAR has also held exhibition races at Suzuka Circuit and Twin Ring Motegi in Japan and <b9_0>Calder Park Thunderdome<b9_0/> in <a4_0>Australia<a4_0/>.
